html: Had a blast with these sweet kiddos at Rockwood Elementary! We read “Grace for President” and talked about how ANYONE can be a leader. I’m so excited for Oklahoma’s next generation and the opportunities we can work together to give them. #oklaedpic.twitter.com/iLZmHORqsw
text: Had a blast with these sweet kiddos at Rockwood Elementary! We read “Grace for President” and talked about how ANYONE can be a leader. I’m so excited for Oklahoma’s next generation and the opportunities we can work together to give them. #oklaedpic.twitter.com/iLZmHORqsw

html: U.S. Rep. Kendra Horn reading "Grace For President" to a group of Kindergartners at Rockwood Elementary. First page shows a picture of all the Presidents and asks "Where are the girl Presidents?" Sparks quite the conversation in the reading circle.pic.twitter.com/cVM0nwLjze
text:
U.S. Rep. Kendra Horn reading "Grace For President" to a group of Kindergartners at Rockwood Elementary. 
First page shows a picture of all the Presidents and asks "Where are the girl Presidents?" 
Sparks quite the conversation in the reading circle.pic.twitter.com/cVM0nwLjze

html: More planes! I toured the FAA facilities here in Oklahoma. That includes the Mike Monroney Center, our country’s only air traffic controller training site. But these people do so much more to make sure we’re all safer, like crash testing and border security support.pic.twitter.com/kzix8HWZMD
text: More planes! I toured the FAA facilities here in Oklahoma. That includes the Mike Monroney Center, our country’s only air traffic controller training site. But these people do so much more to make sure we’re all safer, like crash testing and border security support.pic.twitter.com/kzix8HWZMD

html: Our national security should never be partisan, and it’s clear that Russia interfered in our election. We as Americans deserve to know the facts. I look forward to reviewing the Mueller report. (2/2)
text: Our national security should never be partisan, and it’s clear that Russia interfered in our election. We as Americans deserve to know the facts. I look forward to reviewing the Mueller report. (2/2)

html: It’s our job as Congress to ensure our democracy stays strong. That means pursuing the truth and protecting ourselves from foreign adversaries. (1/2)
text: It’s our job as Congress to ensure our democracy stays strong. That means pursuing the truth and protecting ourselves from foreign adversaries. (1/2)

text:
I’m back home again and so far this “recess,” I have 

 toured Tinker AFB
 convened a roundtable of tribal leaders
 attended the Greater OKC Hispanic Chamber of Commerce Gala
 enjoyed SW 29th street 7th annual festival of the child

#servingOK05 #okleg #whatsnext

html: I'm at Tinker Air Force Base today, but this week, my colleagues and I celebrated our first 100 days in office. Here is the speech I gave on the House floor about what my office has achieved in that time: https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4791942/congresswoman-kendra-horn-100-days …
text: I'm at Tinker Air Force Base today, but this week, my colleagues and I celebrated our first 100 days in office. Here is the speech I gave on the House floor about what my office has achieved in that time: https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4791942/congresswoman-kendra-horn-100-days …

html: Hi everybody! I wanted to update you on what I’ve been doing in DC before I head back to Oklahoma for the next two weeks. I’m looking forward getting home and visiting communities across the district. Hope to see you!pic.twitter.com/VYI0yWsxyk

html: I’m proud our country is working to help women and families recover from abuse by reauthorizing #VAWA, but we also need to consider the long-term effects of trauma. html: As Congress spends tomorrow on #VAWA, I'll be talking at length on social and from the House floor about our need for evidence-based approaches and trauma-informed care.

html: I was honored to support @RepMikeQuigley's #VAWA amendment. It would direct the HHS Secretary to study whether experiencing domestic violence is tied to substance use disorder. Better information helps us better prevention. https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4790036/congresswoman-horn-amendment-requiring-study-domestic-violence-substance-abuse …
text:
I was honored to support @RepMikeQuigley's #VAWA amendment. It would direct the HHS Secretary to study whether experiencing domestic violence is tied to substance use disorder. Better information helps us better prevention. 
https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4790036/congresswoman-horn-amendment-requiring-study-domestic-violence-substance-abuse …

html: We appreciate @RepKendraHorn taking the time to talk with community health center CEOs this week. Health centers provide constituents of every district in Oklahoma with access to high-quality, comprehensive health care.pic.twitter.com/a9LHbuJrl6
text: We appreciate @RepKendraHorn taking the time to talk with community health center CEOs this week. Health centers provide constituents of every district in Oklahoma with access to high-quality, comprehensive health care.pic.twitter.com/a9LHbuJrl6

html: This behavior empowers those who hold hate-filled beliefs. Hate lays the groundwork for violence, and these attacks fan the flame. We won’t sit by and allow hate to take the driver’s seat. As we always have, Oklahomans will come together to show that love is stronger than hate.
text: This behavior empowers those who hold hate-filled beliefs. Hate lays the groundwork for violence, and these attacks fan the flame. We won’t sit by and allow hate to take the driver’s seat. As we always have, Oklahomans will come together to show that love is stronger than hate.

html: I'm heartbroken and troubled to see another display of white supremacy in our state — this time at three locations in Norman. Law enforcement is still investigating, but regardless of intent, subjecting Oklahomans – especially children – to these images is deeply damaging. (1/)
text: I'm heartbroken and troubled to see another display of white supremacy in our state — this time at three locations in Norman. Law enforcement is still investigating, but regardless of intent, subjecting Oklahomans – especially children – to these images is deeply damaging. (1/)

html: Update: H.R. 271 went before the House today, but the final vote was postponed. I continue my support for the bill and will vote on it when I get the chance to.
text: Update: H.R. 271 went before the House today, but the final vote was postponed. I continue my support for the bill and will vote on it when I get the chance to.

html: We need to preserve the ACA’s critical protections and continue to improve health care. That means fighting for lower prescription drug prices and expanding access to mental health and substance abuse services. We need to move forward, not backward.
text: We need to preserve the ACA’s critical protections and continue to improve health care. That means fighting for lower prescription drug prices and expanding access to mental health and substance abuse services. We need to move forward, not backward.

html: I voted yes on H.R. 271 today. It condemns the Administration’s efforts to end the Affordable Care Act without replacing it. The ACA protected Americans with pre-existing conditions, banned lifetime caps and made sure people could stay on their parents’ insurance until they’re 26
text: I voted yes on H.R. 271 today. It condemns the Administration’s efforts to end the Affordable Care Act without replacing it. The ACA protected Americans with pre-existing conditions, banned lifetime caps and made sure people could stay on their parents’ insurance until they’re 26

html: We’re thrilled to unveil this piece by D.G. Smalling, a brilliant Choctaw artist and resident in our district. His work holds a special place in our community. It’s an honor to have it here! Thank you to everyone who dropped in to see it, including @LeaderHoyer.pic.twitter.com/uKRL5BDtpw
text:
We’re thrilled to unveil this piece by D.G. Smalling, a brilliant Choctaw artist and resident in our district. His work holds a special place in our community. It’s an honor to have it here!
Thank you to everyone who dropped in to see it, including @LeaderHoyer.pic.twitter.com/uKRL5BDtpw

html: After two years of extensive and expensive investigations, we deserve more than four pages. My constituents sent me to Congress to change how things work in Washington. We need more transparency not less. (2/2)
text: After two years of extensive and expensive investigations, we deserve more than four pages. My constituents sent me to Congress to change how things work in Washington. We need more transparency not less. (2/2)

html: The attorney general’s letter makes clear there are still unanswered questions about obstruction of justice in Special Counsel Mueller’s report. This makes it all the more urgent that Congress and the American people understand Mr. Mueller's findings from the report itself. (1/2)
text: The attorney general’s letter makes clear there are still unanswered questions about obstruction of justice in Special Counsel Mueller’s report. This makes it all the more urgent that Congress and the American people understand Mr. Mueller's findings from the report itself. (1/2)

html: As Oklahomans, we are no strangers to that.But we also know the power of love and coming together to support each other. We won’t let hatred and fear control us. Let us stand together, support the grieving and create connections that transcend race and religion. (2/2)
text: As Oklahomans, we are no strangers to that.But we also know the power of love and coming together to support each other. We won’t let hatred and fear control us. Let us stand together, support the grieving and create connections that transcend race and religion. (2/2)

html: Our hearts are broken for those mourning the 49 fallen in the Christchurch mosque murders and for the global community who is witnessing another callous loss of life. This devastating attack is but the most recent example of what happens when hate turns to violence. 1/2
text: Our hearts are broken for those mourning the 49 fallen in the Christchurch mosque murders and for the global community who is witnessing another callous loss of life. This devastating attack is but the most recent example of what happens when hate turns to violence. 1/2

html: Honored and humbled to celebrate the @girlscouts’ 107th birthday from the House floor yesterday. Fun fact: 60% of Congress’ female members were Girl Scouts. So we’re virtually all female astronauts, including the first American woman in space, Sally Ride https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4785689/girl-scouts-107th-birthday …
text:

html: Happy belated birthday to OKC Mayor and our social media inspo, @davidfholt! So happy we get to work together for a better Oklahoma. Also happy our photographer here managed to get us both in the frame.pic.twitter.com/icCj7Zq7z8
text: Happy belated birthday to OKC Mayor and our social media inspo, @davidfholt! So happy we get to work together for a better Oklahoma.   Also happy our photographer here managed to get us both in the frame.pic.twitter.com/icCj7Zq7z8

html: In this week’s Connecting with Kendra, I talk a little about getting to be chairwoman of the Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics. #ConnectingwithKendrapic.twitter.com/KamruybZB4
text: In this week’s Connecting with Kendra, I talk a little about getting to be chairwoman of the Subcommittee on Space and Aeronautics. #ConnectingwithKendrapic.twitter.com/KamruybZB4

html: Is this bill perfect? No. But overall this legislation improves how our country performs its most critical work. #HR1 (14/14)
text: Is this bill perfect? No. But overall this legislation improves how our country performs its most critical work. #HR1 (14/14)

html: The bill would create nonpartisan, independent commissions for each state. You’re supposed to choose us, not the other way around. We shouldn’t let politicians pick and choose which voters get to elect them. #HR1 (13/)
text: The bill would create nonpartisan, independent commissions for each state. You’re supposed to choose us, not the other way around. We shouldn’t let politicians pick and choose which voters get to elect them. #HR1 (13/)

html: We want to make sure that your voice is just as important as anyone else’s, regardless of how much or how little you have. #HR1 (12/)
text: We want to make sure that your voice is just as important as anyone else’s, regardless of how much or how little you have. #HR1 (12/)

html: This bill would make sure that you can know who is paying for ads you see on TV or Facebook or Twitter. That Is often a secret now! This would keep foreign-controlled companies from making large donations. #HR1 (11/)
text: This bill would make sure that you can know who is paying for ads you see on TV or Facebook or Twitter. That Is often a secret now! This would keep foreign-controlled companies from making large donations. #HR1 (11/)

html: I don’t see that requirement as a burden. I’m happy to disclose our donors and expenditures. Dark money groups don’t have to tell you where they got their money, who gave it to them or how they spent it. They shouldn’t get special protections. #HR1 (10/)
text: I don’t see that requirement as a burden. I’m happy to disclose our donors and expenditures. Dark money groups don’t have to tell you where they got their money, who gave it to them or how they spent it. They shouldn’t get special protections. #HR1 (10/)

html: I have heard it all across my district: We need to change how Washington works. Outside groups spend billions of dollars to sway policy here. And although members of congress have to disclose every dollar that flows into our campaign accounts, outside groups don’t. #HR1 (9/)
text: I have heard it all across my district: We need to change how Washington works. Outside groups spend billions of dollars to sway policy here. And although members of congress have to disclose every dollar that flows into our campaign accounts, outside groups don’t. #HR1 (9/)

html: The bill authorizes $1 billion to help states strengthen their security systems. Is that a lot of money? Yes. But again, election access and security are key to our democracy. #HR1 (8/)
text: The bill authorizes $1 billion to help states strengthen their security systems. Is that a lot of money? Yes. But again, election access and security are key to our democracy. #HR1 (8/)

html: We must also ensure our voting systems are secure. Although OK's voter access could improve, our system sets an example for the rest of the country. It is consistent statewide, uses easy-to-read paper ballots and machines that have never been connected to the internet. #HR1 (7/)
text: We must also ensure our voting systems are secure. Although OK's voter access could improve, our system sets an example for the rest of the country. It is consistent statewide, uses easy-to-read paper ballots and machines that have never been connected to the internet. #HR1 (7/)

html: Voting limitations like these disproportionately affect our minority communities. Our nation has a long history of disenfranchising people of color. The Voting Rights Act helped address that, but there is still work to do. #HR1 (6/)
text: Voting limitations like these disproportionately affect our minority communities. Our nation has a long history of disenfranchising people of color. The Voting Rights Act helped address that, but there is still work to do. #HR1 (6/)

html: Our laws create unnecessary burdens. In OK, we require a notary on all absentee ballots. Our state has no history of absentee ballot fraud. In other states, punishments don’t fit crimes; laws revoke the right to vote even after sentences are completed. #HR1 (5/)
text: Our laws create unnecessary burdens. In OK, we require a notary on all absentee ballots. Our state has no history of absentee ballot fraud. In other states, punishments don’t fit crimes; laws revoke the right to vote even after sentences are completed. #HR1 (5/)

html: I just got back from the Congressional Civil Rights Pilgrimage, where we toured some of the most pivotal sites in our nation’s civil rights history. People there died for their right to vote, but there are still Americans who lack this access. #HR1 (4/)
text: I just got back from the Congressional Civil Rights Pilgrimage, where we toured some of the most pivotal sites in our nation’s civil rights history. People there died for their right to vote, but there are still Americans who lack this access. #HR1 (4/)

html: Here is a highlight of what I think is most important. It makes registering to vote easier. It ensures our elections are more secure. It shines a light on outside groups and their money in Washington. And it ensures you pick us, not the other way around. #HR1 (3/)
text: Here is a highlight of what I think is most important. It makes registering to vote easier. It ensures our elections are more secure. It shines a light on outside groups and their money in Washington. And it ensures you pick us, not the other way around. #HR1 (3/)

html: There is literally nothing more important that we can and should do than ensuring our democracy is protected. The foundation of everything we do – national security, education, everything – is our democratic system. We have to make sure every single citizen has a voice. #HR1 (2/)
text: There is literally nothing more important that we can and should do than ensuring our democracy is protected. The foundation of everything we do – national security, education, everything – is our democratic system. We have to make sure every single citizen has a voice. #HR1 (2/)

html: Y’all have probably seen a lot about #HR1, also known as the For the People Act of 2019. It’s a big bill with a lot of things in it. I’m supporting it. Here is a thread about why. (1/)

html: Every American has the right to be safe from domestic and sexual violence, yet Congress allowed the Violence Against Women Act to expire. It’s time to right that wrong and empower communities and survivors like never before. It’s time to reauthorize #VAWA. #VAWA4ALL #VAWA19pic.twitter.com/dIyJ9sH7fG
text:
Every American has the right to be safe from domestic and sexual violence, yet Congress allowed the Violence Against Women Act to expire.

It’s time to right that wrong and empower communities and survivors like never before. It’s time to reauthorize #VAWA. #VAWA4ALL #VAWA19pic.twitter.com/dIyJ9sH7fG

html: The expanded protection for Native women in this bill is vital. Four in five Indian and Alaskan Native women have experienced violence, according to the Indian Law Resource Center.
text: The expanded protection for Native women in this bill is vital. Four in five Indian and Alaskan Native women have experienced violence, according to the Indian Law Resource Center.

html: I couldn’t be more proud of my brave colleague, Rep. Katie Porter. She shared her own experience with domestic violence, and explained why supports for every member of the family are vital.pic.twitter.com/HgWLgIDTqZ
text: I couldn’t be more proud of my brave colleague, Rep. Katie Porter. She shared her own experience with domestic violence, and explained why supports for every member of the family are vital.pic.twitter.com/HgWLgIDTqZ

html: This bill ensures we continue policies that support women and families in crisis. That includes an increase in funding for services. According to the YWCA, Oklahoma serves nearly 18,000 people every year.
text: This bill ensures we continue policies that support women and families in crisis. That includes an increase in funding for services. According to the YWCA, Oklahoma serves nearly 18,000 people every year.

html: I was proud to stand today with survivors, service providers and women and men from both sides of the aisle to introduce the Violence Against Women Act reauthorization. There is nothing partisan about protecting women. #VAWA19pic.twitter.com/bZLupu7OYF
text: I was proud to stand today with survivors, service providers and women and men from both sides of the aisle to introduce the Violence Against Women Act reauthorization. There is nothing partisan about protecting women. #VAWA19pic.twitter.com/bZLupu7OYF

html: I can’t express how grateful I am to The Faith & Politics Institute, Mr. Lewis and other luminaries that led this year’s Congressional Civil Rights Pilgrimage, and to my friend Oklahoma Senator George Young for sharing it with us.
text: I can’t express how grateful I am to The Faith & Politics Institute, Mr. Lewis and other luminaries that led this year’s Congressional Civil Rights Pilgrimage, and to my friend Oklahoma Senator George Young for sharing it with us.

html: This week in 1965, civil rights advocates marched across this bridge fighting for their right to vote. They were beaten, tear gassed. 50 years later, our voting laws are still unjust. Grateful to @repjohnlewis for reminding us of our history that reveals the work we have left.pic.twitter.com/xMMBrvJhWe
text: This week in 1965, civil rights advocates marched across this bridge fighting for their right to vote. They were beaten, tear gassed. 50 years later, our voting laws are still unjust. Grateful to @repjohnlewis for reminding us of our history that reveals the work we have left.pic.twitter.com/xMMBrvJhWe

html: Clara Luper, Oklahoma‘s civil rights icon, deserves to be a household name. She led the country’s first sit-ins and sacrificed her safety to empower a generation. I was humbled to share her story on the House floor. #BlackHistoryMonth http://www.c-span.org/video/?c4782817/congresswoman-kendra-horn-oklahoma-city-civil-rights-pioneer-clara-luper …pic.twitter.com/y6FrMokCYD
text:
Clara Luper, Oklahoma‘s civil rights icon, deserves to be a household name. She led the country’s first sit-ins and sacrificed her safety to empower a generation. I was humbled to share her story on the House floor. #BlackHistoryMonth
http://www.c-span.org/video/?c4782817/congresswoman-kendra-horn-oklahoma-city-civil-rights-pioneer-clara-luper …pic.twitter.com/y6FrMokCYD

html: Yesterday, I got to have my first meet up with fellow Democrats on the House Subcommittee Space and Aeronautics, which I am chairing. I’m so excited about the work we will get to do and to start holding official meetings. We’ll update you on what’s to come soon.pic.twitter.com/6E8HwjPO6B

html: .@GirlScouts is one of my absolute favorite organizations, and it’s not just the Thin Mints. There are few causes closer to my heart than teaching girls to lead. As a fourth-generation scout, I was elated to meet CEO Sylvia Acevedo in my office today. Keep it up!pic.twitter.com/7BLhQgb15N
text: .@GirlScouts is one of my absolute favorite organizations, and it’s not just the Thin Mints. There are few causes closer to my heart than teaching girls to lead. As a fourth-generation scout, I was elated to meet  CEO Sylvia Acevedo in my office today. Keep it up!pic.twitter.com/7BLhQgb15N

html: I was proud to vote in favor of #HR8, a commonsense policy to address our country’s widespread gun violence. I also sponsored an amendment that creates exceptions for people facing intimate partner violence and domestic abuse. See my speech here https://www.c-span.org/video/?c4782797/congresswoman-kendra-horn-presents-amendment-hr-8 …pic.twitter.com/AQ4P4gzVAN
text: I was proud to vote in favor of #HR8, a commonsense policy to address our country’s widespread gun violence. html: Today’s full Moon is also… wait for it… a supermoon! The Moon is close to its perigee, which is the closest point in its orbit to Earth. This means this full Moon appears brighter and bigger than other full Moons throughout the year. https://svs.gsfc.nasa.gov/4442 pic.twitter.com/OFgQtE6xWG
text: Today’s full Moon is also… wait for it… a supermoon! The Moon is close to its perigee, which is the closest point in its orbit to Earth. This means this full Moon appears brighter and bigger than other full Moons throughout the year. https://svs.gsfc.nasa.gov/4442 pic.twitter.com/OFgQtE6xWG

html: Contractors and NASA are executing the next generation of exploration: deep space. We need stability — in funding and policy. We can’t let ourselves be pulled back and forth. Exploration cannot be a partisan issue. Honored to speak at the SLS/Orion/EGS Suppliers Conference.pic.twitter.com/srDsw8KqTq
text: Contractors and NASA are executing the next generation of exploration: deep space. We need stability — in funding and policy. We can’t let ourselves be pulled back and forth. Exploration cannot be a partisan issue. Honored to speak at the SLS/Orion/EGS Suppliers Conference.pic.twitter.com/srDsw8KqTq

html: Last year, the US saw a record 33 licensed space launches. In many ways, it’s no longer a conversation about commercial or government space flight, but about the relationship between the two. I’m excited about the future of this industry. Thank you for having me, @csf_spaceflightpic.twitter.com/IGLpOcUYmY
text: Last year, the US saw a record 33 licensed space launches. In many ways, it’s no longer a conversation about commercial or government space flight, but about the relationship between the two. html: Today, in my inaugural speech on the House floor I discussed the national security and economic impacts of the closure of Oklahoma City’s FAA Mike Moroney Aeronautical Center. The Aeronautical center is one of the ten largest employers in Oklahoma. https://media.c-spanvideo.org/trimmed/clip/475/4754278/clip.4754278.MP4-D20.mp4?Policy=eyJTdGF0ZW1lbnQiOlt7IlJlc291cmNlIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9tZWRpYS5jLXNwYW52aWRlby5vcmcvdHJpbW1lZC9jbGlwLzQ3NS80NzU0Mjc4L2NsaXAuNDc1NDI3OC5NUDQtRDIwLm1wNCIsIkNvbmRpdGlvbiI6eyJEYXRlTGVzc1RoYW4iOnsiQVdTOkVwb2NoVGltZSI6MTU0ODM2MzkxMX0sIklQQWRkcmVzcyI6eyJBV1M6U291cmNlSXAiOiIxNDMuMjMxLjI0OS4xMzYifX19XX0_&Signature=BrvbicDW8HBcF~Ln81bT3RFMWsjbAk6KI5ZOc3aimSPS7vQhqddVBho1TU6esK48oDOEzkCiGrWN8dtm2mIj0JvKEK31vu9FZWm8NsZia7XSBP9lDmOFKEsVFqmRSWhU3niBlquMWhaRrNDxqKHi88s1X3qBSO6Ob6-hj0rqBpE_&Key-Pair-Id=APKAIHKVWBEAXX562G7Q …
text:
Today, in my inaugural speech on the House floor I discussed the national security and economic impacts of the closure of Oklahoma City’s FAA Mike Moroney Aeronautical Center. The Aeronautical center is one of the ten largest employers in Oklahoma.

html: Hello Twitter! I am excited to be representing the people of the 5th District of Oklahoma! #MyFirstTweet
